name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components: (1) The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant increase due to its high electronegativity, which raises the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. (2) The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can contribute around +10 degrees Celsius. (3) The carboxylic acid group introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, which can contribute around +10 degrees Celsius. (4) The trifluoromethyl group also introduces a significant increase due to its high electronegativity, which raises the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius.
